DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to perform a prospective, randomised study investigating the safety and efficacy of cryoballoon catheter ablation compared with radiofrequency ablation(contact force), in the treatment of persistent AF.
DOC.brief_title: Study Comparing Pulmonary Vein Isolation With the Cryoballoon and Radiofrequency Energy(Contact Force) in the Treatment of Persistent Atrial Fibrillation (AF) (Cryo Vs CF in PerAF)
DOC.detailed_description: The hypotheses for this study is that cryothermal energy is as effective and safe as using radiofrequency energy in the treatment of persistent AF and is associated with a better long term outcome.
DOC.criteria: persistent Atrial Fibrillation; Intolerant to antiarrhythmic medication; Both male or female; Age from 18 to 75 years old. Acute myocardial infarction; Coronary artery stent history; Acute severe stroke; Abnormal liver and renal function.
